metadata.description: Clinimetric tools database for physiotherapy assessment
metadata.usage_note: Tools are organized by ICF domain and include HOAC step relevance for clinical reasoning integration

icf_domain_legend.body_function: Physiological functions of body systems (including psychological)
icf_domain_legend.activity: Execution of a task or action by an individual
icf_domain_legend.personal_factors: Individual background of life and living (not classified in ICF)

hoac_step_legend.step_1: Collect Initial Data - history, subjective exam
hoac_step_legend.step_2: Generate Problem Statements - identify activity limitations, participation restrictions
hoac_step_legend.step_3: Establish Goals - SMART goals linked to problems
hoac_step_legend.step_5: Develop Plan of Care - frequency, duration, progression
hoac_step_legend.step_7: Re-evaluate - outcome measurement and clinical reasoning

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: When body composition may influence treatment planning or outcomes
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: How might this patient's BMI affect their exercise tolerance, joint loading, or intervention selection?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Using BMI as sole indicator of health without considering muscle mass, fitness level, or functional capacity

resources.key_article: Nuttall FQ. Body Mass Index: Obesity, BMI, and Health: A Critical Review. Nutr Today. 2015

tools.name: Patient Specific Functional Scale
tools.outcome_measured: Activities of Daily Living, Patient-identified activities

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: At initial assessment and re-evaluation to track patient-centered outcomes
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Are the activities the patient identified truly reflecting their main participation restrictions?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Leading the patient to select activities rather than letting them identify what matters most to them

resources.key_article: Horn KK et al. The Patient-Specific Functional Scale: Psychometrics, Clinimetrics, and Application. JOSPT 2012

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Before exercise testing, during cardiovascular conditions, medication monitoring
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: How does this blood pressure reading influence your exercise prescription or intervention intensity?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not considering orthostatic changes or exercise response patterns

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: When joint mobility is relevant to the patient's activity limitations
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Is this ROM limitation a primary impairment causing the activity limitation, or a secondary finding?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Measuring ROM without connecting it to functional relevance or activity limitations

resources.key_article: Gajdosik RL, Bohannon RW. Clinical measurement of range of motion. Phys Ther. 1987

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: When objective strength measurement is needed for goal setting or progress monitoring
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Is the strength deficit you measured contributing to the patient's functional limitations?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not standardizing testing position or stabilization across measurements

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Quick clinical strength assessment, neurological screening
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: What is the pattern of weakness telling you about the underlying pathology?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not recognizing the ordinal nature of the scale (difference between grades is not equal)

interpretation.grade_4: Active movement against gravity and resistance

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Pain assessment at each session, before/after interventions
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: What does the pain pattern tell you about tissue irritability and appropriate intervention intensity?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Focusing only on pain reduction without addressing underlying causes or functional impact

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Initial assessment to identify patient's main activity limitations
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Are these complaints truly activity limitations (ICF) or are they impairments or participation restrictions?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Confusing impairments (pain, stiffness) with activity limitations (cannot walk 500m)

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Research settings or when continuous scale is preferred over discrete NPRS
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Why did you choose VAS over NPRS for this patient?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not using a standardized 100mm line or measuring imprecisely

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: ACL rehabilitation, return-to-sport testing, lower limb power assessment
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: What limb symmetry index are you aiming for before return to sport?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Using as isolated criterion for return-to-sport rather than part of comprehensive battery

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Pre-participation screening, identifying movement dysfunction patterns
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: How will you use FMS findings to guide your intervention selection?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Over-relying on FMS score as injury predictor (evidence is mixed)

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Lower extremity injury risk screening, ankle instability assessment
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: What asymmetries are you looking for and what do they indicate?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not normalizing for leg length

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Sports performance testing, lower limb power assessment
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: How does jump height relate to your patient's sport-specific demands?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not standardizing arm swing or countermovement

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Baseline gait assessment, neurological conditions, falls risk, frailty screening
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: What does this gait speed tell you about community ambulation ability and fall risk?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not differentiating between comfortable and fast gait speed testing

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Fall risk assessment, functional mobility baseline, geriatric assessment
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Which component of the TUG is most problematic - the sit-to-stand, walking, or turning?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Only reporting time without observing quality of movement components

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Lower extremity strength screening, fall risk assessment
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: How does this functional strength measure relate to the patient's reported difficulty with transfers?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not controlling for chair height or arm use

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Screening for cognitive impairment in geriatric or neurological patients
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: How will cognitive status influence your treatment approach and education strategies?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not adjusting communication and education based on cognitive findings

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Geriatric assessment, identifying frailty for intervention planning
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: How does frailty status affect your prognosis and intervention intensity decisions?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not considering the multidimensional nature of frailty (physical, psychological, social)

tools.name: Barthel Index
tools.outcome_measured: Activities of Daily Living, Functional Mobility, Gait

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Stroke and neurological rehabilitation, ADL independence assessment
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Which specific ADL items are most limiting and should be prioritized in treatment?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Using total score without analyzing which specific items need intervention

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Exercise prescription, monitoring training intensity
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: How are you using RPE to guide exercise intensity progression?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not explaining the scale properly to patients or not correlating with heart rate

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Stroke rehabilitation, assessing sitting balance and trunk control
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: How does trunk control relate to your patient's ability to perform transfers and walking?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not recognizing trunk control as predictor of functional recovery in stroke

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Balance assessment, fall risk prediction, neurological/geriatric populations
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Which items are most impaired and what does this tell you about the balance system affected?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Reporting only total score without analyzing item-level performance

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Acute care, hospital, rehabilitation settings - assessing mobility hierarchy
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: At what mobility level is the patient currently functioning and what is the next achievable goal?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not using hierarchical nature to guide progressive goal setting

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Fall risk assessment, identifying fear of falling as participation barrier
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Is fear of falling appropriate given objective fall risk, or is it limiting participation excessively?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not addressing fear of falling as separate treatment target from physical fall risk

tools.name: Mini Balance Evaluation System Test
tools.outcome_measured: Balance systems (anticipatory, reactive, sensory, dynamic gait)

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: When you need to identify WHICH balance system is impaired to guide treatment
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Which balance subsystem (anticipatory, reactive, sensory, gait) is most impaired?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not using subsystem scores to guide targeted intervention selection

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Neurological conditions with suspected spasticity
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Is this spasticity functionally limiting or potentially helpful for the patient?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Assuming all spasticity should be reduced - sometimes it aids function

interpretation.grade_1_plus: Slight increase in tone through less than half of ROM
interpretation.grade_2: More marked increase through most of ROM

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Stroke assessment of motor impairment
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: How does this motor impairment level predict functional recovery potential?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not using MI as prognostic indicator for motor recovery

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Classifying gait independence level in neurological patients
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: What is needed to progress to the next FAC level?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not using FAC categories to guide progressive gait training goals

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Geriatric assessment, frailty screening, predicting disability
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Which component (balance, gait, strength) is most impaired and should be prioritized?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not analyzing subscores - each component provides different clinical information

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Parkinson's disease - assessing transfers, gait, bed mobility
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Which daily activity is most affected by the patient's Parkinson's symptoms?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not considering medication timing (ON vs OFF state) when assessing

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: When 6MWT is too fatiguing or space limited, frail populations
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Is this patient too frail for 6MWT? Is 2MWT providing sufficient challenge?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not standardizing encouragement and rest protocols

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Fall risk assessment in elderly, balance and gait evaluation
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Is the gait or balance component more impaired?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not separating gait (12 points) and balance (16 points) subscores

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Chronic conditions, adherence assessment, self-management readiness
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: How might low self-efficacy affect treatment adherence and outcome?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not targeting self-efficacy as modifiable factor in treatment

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Submaximal aerobic capacity assessment
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: What are the limitations of submaximal VO2max estimation?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not recognizing assumptions (linear HR-workload relationship, age-predicted HRmax)

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Field-based aerobic capacity assessment when cycle ergometer unavailable
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: What factors might affect validity in this patient (musculoskeletal issues, balance)?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Using in patients with lower limb pathology affecting stepping ability

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Screening for psychological factors in chronic pain, unexplained symptoms
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: How do psychological factors influence this patient's presentation and prognosis?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not addressing elevated scores or referring appropriately

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Cardiac, pulmonary, neurological conditions - submaximal functional exercise capacity
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: How does the distance walked relate to community ambulation requirements?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not standardizing encouragement, track length, or monitoring symptoms

tools.name: Disabilities of the Arm, Shoulder and Hand

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Upper extremity conditions - outcome measurement
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Which specific upper limb activities are most limiting for this patient?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not analyzing which items are scoring highest

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Rehabilitation settings - comprehensive ADL and mobility assessment
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Which motor vs cognitive items are most impaired?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not separating motor (91 points) and cognitive (35 points) subscores

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Neck pain conditions - baseline and outcome assessment
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Which activities (reading, driving, work) are most affected?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not connecting NDI items to specific treatment targets

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Chronic pain, post-injury - assessing fear-avoidance beliefs
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: How is kinesiophobia contributing to activity avoidance and disability?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not targeting kinesiophobia specifically with education and graded exposure

tools.name: Hip Dysfunction and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Hip osteoarthritis, hip arthroplasty, hip pathology
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Which subscale (pain, symptoms, ADL, sport, QoL) is most affected?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Only reporting total score without subscale analysis

tools.name: Knee Injury and Osteoarthritis Outcome Score

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Knee osteoarthritis, ACL injury, meniscus pathology
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Which subscale (pain, symptoms, ADL, sport, QoL) is most affected?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Only reporting total score without subscale analysis

tools.name: Western Ontario and McMaster Universities Arthritis Index

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Hip and knee osteoarthritis
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Is pain, stiffness, or functional limitation the primary issue?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not using subscales to guide intervention focus

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Exercise prescription, cardiovascular monitoring
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: How are you using heart rate to guide exercise intensity?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not considering medications affecting heart rate (beta-blockers)

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Upper extremity dexterity in neurological conditions
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: How does dexterity relate to the patient's ADL requirements?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not comparing affected vs unaffected side

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: All shoulder conditions  primary patient-reported outcome measure for shoulder pain and function
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Which subscale (pain vs disability) is driving the overall score? How does this inform your treatment priorities?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not analyzing pain and disability subscales separately  a high pain score with low disability suggests different treatment focus than the reverse

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Post-operative shoulder assessment, comprehensive functional evaluation combining subjective and objective domains
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Which domain (pain, ADL, ROM, strength) is most impaired? Does the strength component require dynamometry?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not standardizing the strength measurement component  requires hand-held dynamometer in specific position for reliable results

resources.key_article: Constant CR, Murley AH. A clinical method of functional assessment of the shoulder. Clin Orthop Relat Res. 1987;(214):160-4

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Quick functional assessment for shoulder conditions, pre/post-operative monitoring
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Which specific functional tasks can the patient not perform? How do these relate to their participation goals?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not connecting SST items to patient-specific activity limitations and goals

clinimetric_properties.note: 12 yes/no questions about functional shoulder tasks

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Chronic or subacute pain conditions where catastrophizing is suspected as perpetuating factor. Especially relevant in shoulder tendinopathy with yellow flags.
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: How is catastrophizing contributing to this patient's pain experience and activity avoidance? Which subscale (rumination, magnification, helplessness) is dominant?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not recognizing catastrophizing as modifiable factor  treating it as fixed personality trait rather than targetable with education and graded exposure

resources.key_article: Sullivan MJL, Bishop SR, Pivik J. The Pain Catastrophizing Scale: Development and Validation. Psychol Assess. 1995;7(4):524-32

clinimetric_properties.mcid: Not firmly established; clinical significance typically >38% change

tools.name: rebro Musculoskeletal Pain Questionnaire
tools.outcome_measured: Risk of work disability and chronic pain development

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Subacute musculoskeletal pain (4-12 weeks) to screen for chronicity risk. Especially relevant for shoulder patients with work-related risk factors.
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: What is this patient's risk profile for developing chronic pain/disability? How does this change your treatment priorities?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Using only for screening without integrating results into treatment planning  high MPQ should shift focus toward psychosocial interventions

resources.key_article: Linton SJ, Boersma K. Early identification of patients at risk of developing a persistent back pain disability. Clin J Pain. 2003;19(2):80-86

clinimetric_properties.note: 25-item screening questionnaire covering pain, function, psychological factors, work factors

tools.name: Quick Disabilities of Arm, Shoulder and Hand
tools.outcome_measured: Upper extremity disability (shortened version of DASH)

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Upper extremity conditions  shorter alternative to full DASH (11 items vs 30). Optional work and sport/performing arts modules.
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: How does the patient's QuickDASH score correlate with their patient-specific complaints? Are the optional modules relevant for this patient?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not administering optional work or sport modules when these are the patient's primary participation restrictions

clinimetric_properties.items: 11 core items + optional 4-item work module + optional 4-item sport module

tools.name: American Shoulder and Elbow Surgeons Score

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Shoulder conditions  particularly post-operative monitoring. Widely used in orthopaedic research.
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: How does this score compare to normative values? Is the pain or function component more limiting?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not recognizing that ASES is heavily weighted toward self-reported function  combine with objective measures

tools.name: Western Ontario Rotator Cuff Index
tools.outcome_measured: Quality of life specific to rotator cuff pathology
tools.outcome_unit: Score (0-2100, higher = worse; often converted to percentage)

coaching_prompts.when_to_use: Specifically for rotator cuff pathology  captures domains beyond pain and function including emotional and lifestyle impact
coaching_prompts.clinical_reasoning_question: Which domain (physical symptoms, sports/recreation, work, lifestyle, emotions) is most affected? How does this guide your intervention priorities?
coaching_prompts.common_student_error: Not using a condition-specific outcome measure when available  generic measures may miss important shoulder-specific limitations
